tool.name: PARalyzer
tool.description: A method to map interaction sites between RNA-binding proteins and their targets
tool.command:
#if $refGenomeSource.genomeSource == "history": faToTwoBit '$refGenomeSource.ownFile' ownFile.2bit && #end if
## genome source #if $refGenomeSource.genomeSource == "history": echo 'GENOME_2BIT_FILE=ownFile.2bit' > input.ini && #else echo 'GENOME_2BIT_FILE=$refGenomeSource.builtin.fields.path' > input.ini && #end if
echo 'SAM_FILE=$input_sam$collapse' >> input.ini &&
#if $methods.choice == "ADDITIONAL_NUCLEOTIDES_BEYOND_SIGNAL": echo 'ADDITIONAL_NUCLEOTIDES_BEYOND_SIGNAL=$methods.max_num' >> input.ini && #else: echo '$methods.choice' >> input.ini && #end if
#if $conversion.selection == "custom": echo 'CONVERSION=$conversion.character_from>$conversion.character_to' >> input.ini && #end if
## required parameters #if $params.settingsType == "custom": echo 'BANDWIDTH=$params.BANDWIDTH' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_PER_GROUP=$params.min_read_group' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_PER_CLUSTER=$params.min_read_cluster' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_FOR_KDE=$params.min_read_kde' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_FOR_CLUSTER_INCLUSION=$params.min_read_cluster_inc' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_CLUSTER_SIZE=$params.min_cluster_size' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_CONVERSION_LOCATIONS_FOR_CLUSTER=$params.min_conv_loc_cluster' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_CONVERSION_COUNT_FOR_CLUSTER=$params.min_conv_cluster' >> input.ini && echo 'MINIMUM_READ_LENGTH=$params.min_read_len' >> input.ini && echo 'MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_NON_CONVERSION_MISMATCHES=$params.max_num_conv_mis' >> input.ini && #end if
echo 'OUTPUT_DISTRIBUTIONS_FILE=out.distribution' >> input.ini && echo 'OUTPUT_GROUPS_FILE=out.groups' >> input.ini && echo 'OUTPUT_CLUSTERS_FILE=out.clusters' >> input.ini && echo 'OUTPUT_READS_FILE=out_PARalyzer_Utilized.sam' >> input.ini &&
## execute paralyzer ## note the 2nd argument is the memory parameter ## the parameter can be override in job_conf.xml e.g. ## <env id="_JAVA_OPTIONS">-Xmx12G</env> PARalyzer 2G input.ini

param.name: input_sam
param.label: Alignment
param.help: The sam file containing alignment of the read data.

param.name: collapse
param.label: Incorporate the read copy number
param.help: If reads were collapse before alignment and you want to incorporate the read copy number, please select Yes, otherwise select No

param.name: genomeSource
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in genome?
param.help: The version of genome against which the reads were aligned.
param.option: Use a genome from my current history

validator.message: A built-in reference genome is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.name: choice
param.label: Please select one of the following

param.name: max_num
param.label: The maximum number
param.help: The maximum number of reads to extend beyond the positive signal in each direction (default 0) the cluster is defined

param.name: character_to
param.label: Character to
param.help: Character representing what the modified ribonucleotide is read as by rTranscriptase (default 'C')

param.name: settingsType
param.label: Required parameters
param.help: You can use the default settings or set custom values for any of paralyzer's parameters.

param.name: BANDWIDTH
param.label: BANDWIDTH
param.help: Size of bandwidth for KDE calculation (default 3)

param.name: min_read_group
param.label: MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_PER_GROUP
param.help: Minimum number of reads required to call a group (default 10)

param.name: min_read_cluster
param.label: MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_PER_CLUSTER
param.help: Minimum number of reads required to call a cluster (default 1)

param.name: min_read_kde
param.label: MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_FOR_KDE
param.help: Minimum read depth at a location to make a KDE estimate (default 1, recommend 5)

param.name: min_read_cluster_inc
param.label: MINIMUM_READ_COUNT_FOR_CLUSTER_INCLUSION
param.help: Minimum read depth for a location to be included within a cluster (default 1)

param.name: min_cluster_size
param.label: MINIMUM_CLUSTER_SIZE
param.help: Minimum length required for a cluster to be reported (default 1)

param.name: min_conv_loc_cluster
param.label: MINIMUM_CONVERSION_LOCATIONS_FOR_CLUSTER
param.help: Minimum number of separate locations to have a reported conversion for a cluster to be reported (default 1, recommend 2)

param.name: min_conv_cluster
param.label: MINIMUM_CONVERSION_COUNT_FOR_CLUSTER
param.help: Minimum number of conversion events within a region to report a cluster (default 1)

param.name: min_read_len
param.label: MINIMUM_READ_LENGTH
param.help: Minimum length of mapped read to be included in the analysis (default 1)

param.name: max_num_conv_mis
param.label: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_NON_CONVERSION_MISMATCHES
param.help: Maximum number of non-conversion mismatches of a mapped read to be included in the analysis (default 5)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
`pipmir`_ is an algorithm to identify novel plant miRNA genes from a combination of deep sequencing data and genomic features.
.. _pipmir: https://ohlerlab.mdc-berlin.de/software/Pipeline_for_the_Identification_of_Plant_miRNAs_84/
.. class:: infomark
**Optional parameters**
Minimum size * The MINIMUM size the precursor predictor can search. * 50 is recommended (and is the default).
Maximum size * The MAXIMUM size the precursor predictor can search.
* The larger you make this, the longer PIPmiR will take as folding time is exponential with increased size.
* 500 is what was used in the manuscript and will include almost all currently known Arabidopsis Thaliana miRNAs.
* 300 is a limit that will include most known miRNAs and still have a reasonable search time.
Step size * The step size used to identify the precursor from the minimum to the maximum possible size of a precursor.
* Increasing this value will speed up the precursor prediction step but limit the number of possible precursor sequences.
* 2 is the default and is what was used in the manuscript, however 5 still works well enough, and is only slightly less accurate
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
A `bed`_ file of putative mature miRNAs * 'name' column = an arbitrary name given to the putative mature * 'score' column = the read count
.. _bed: https://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat#format1
A text file of predicted precursors * Form: Chromosome,Strand,Precursor_Start,Precursor_End,Sequence,Fold_Structure,Normalized_Minimum_Free_Energy,Mature_miRNA_Location
* Chromosome = chromosome that the precursor is on
* Strand = strand that the precursor is on
* Precursor_Start = start nucleotide (1 based) of the precursor
* Precursor_End = last nucleotide (1 based, inclusive) of the precursor
* Sequence = sequence of the precursor
* Fold_Structure = dot-bracket notation of the precursor fold centroid secondary structure (generated from RNAfold -p -d2 -noLP -noPS)
* Normalized_Minimum_Free_Energy = minimum free energy of the centroid structure divided by the length of the sequence
* Mature_miRNA_location = name & location of the mature miRNA within the precursor sequence
A text file of predicted miRNAs * This file will contain the miRNAs that had a positive classifier score, meaning that PIPmiR believes that they may be novel miRNA genes.
* This file contains the genomic coordinates of the predicted precursor as well as for the mature and star sequences.
* The file also contains the precursor sequence and the dot-bracket notation of its secondary structure.
